http://wn.com/Allen_Iverson_19pts_vs_Nets_08/09_NBA_*Clutch_Plays Allen Iverson and Tayshaun Prince stepped up for the short-handed Detroit Pistons. Allen Iverson scored 19 points, and Tayshaun Prince added 16 to help the Pistons win their fifth straight game, 83-75 over the New Jersey Nets on Wednesday. When any team in the league loses three of their top six guys, things are going to change for them, Pistons coach Mike D'Antoni Curry said. "Luckily, a lot of other guys stepped up." Detroit played without Rip Hamilton ( groin) and Antonio McDyess ( ribs), and lost Rasheed Wallace to a first-half foot injury,

away from the Warriors with an 11-2 run to open the quarter and actually kept their double-digit lead for most of the rest of the game. "It felt like we turned that corner," Allen Iverson said. Fatboy Slim just did everything right at the end. I think Chris Webber did a great job at the end. Fatboy Slim ran the offense through him and he made some great things happen.
